title: Average value a function from its graph

content.question: The graphs of five functions are shown below. Which function has a nonzero average value over the closed interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>π</mi> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D3C@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

choices.label: A graph plots a curve that originates from the point negative pi comma 0, falls down to a minimum point with y equals negative 1, further rises to a point below the negative x axis, bends and passes through the origin. The curve then bends in the first quadrant and rises to a maximum point in the first quadrant with y equals 1, and further falls down to the point pi comma 0.

A graph plots a curve that originates from the point negative pi comma 0, rises to a maximum point with y equals 4, falls down to a minimum point on the negative x axis nearer to the origin. The curve horizontally passes through the origin to a point on the positive x axis, falls down to a minimum point with y equals negative 4, and further rises to the point pi comma 0.

A graph plots a bell shaped curve that originates from the point negative pi comma negative 1, rises to a maximum point 0 comma 1, and falls down to the point pi comma negative 1. All values estimated.

A graph plots a curve that originates in the second quadrant above the point negative pi comma 1, falls down to a point in the third quadrant, rises through the origin to a point in the first quadrant, and further falls down into the fourth quadrant below the point pi comma negative 1.

A graph plots a curve that resembles an inverted W. The curve originates at the bottom of the third quadrant with x equals negative pi, rises to a point in the second quadrant, falls down to the negative x axis, and passes through the origin to the positive x axis. The curve rises to a point in the first quadrant and falls down into the fourth quadrant with x equals pi.

content.answer: A graph plots a curve that resembles an inverted W. The curve originates at the bottom of the third quadrant with x equals negative pi, rises to a point in the second quadrant, falls down to the negative x axis, and passes through the origin to the positive x axis. The curve rises to a point in the first quadrant and falls down into the fourth quadrant with x equals pi.

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
